requirement.topic: The XmlBlaster stores MessageUnits persistent in a xmldb. The persistence is controlled by a QoS-Flag.
requirement.description:
The xmldb is a transparent layer for the engine. MessageUnits are stored in a file-database if the QoS-Tag <isDurable /> is set. MessageUnits are cached in the memory and mapped on the disk with COPY-BACK-Caching. The xmldb contains of a memory-cache ,file-database and a DOM which contanis the XmlKey. The settings for the xmldb can be done in the xmlBlaster.properties.

Caching:
The caching strategy used is "least recently used" (LRU). If the cache has reached the max. Cachesize, then the cache will be swapped each MessageUnit with LRU to the file-database.

Dom:
A DOM-Tree contains all XmlKey's for each MessageUnits in the cache and file-database.

Persistence:
If the Qos-Flag <isDurable/> is set, the xmldb writes the MessageUnit in a file with write-through-strategy.
